headline: Raid on North Korea’s Madrid Embassy a ‘Grave Terrorist Attack,’ Pyongyang Says
summary: North Korea called a February intrusion of its Spanish embassy an “act of extortion,” marking Pyongyang’s first public remarks about a puzzling raid by secretive dissidents hoping to topple the regime of Kim Jong Un.

headline: The Final Four Is Set After Michigan State Defeats Duke
summary: The Final Four is set: Michigan State joined Texas Tech, Auburn and Virginia after beating Duke, the basketball tournament's top overall seed. The Spartans won, 68-67, on an unlikely 3-pointer by Kenny Goins.

headline: Cuomo Tightens Control Over Board Tied to Amazon Deal’s Undoing
summary: Still stung by the demise of Amazon’s plan to build a campus in Queens, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo successfully pushed a budget provision that would give him more power over the state board that held sway over the project.

headline: Auburn Is Streaking to the Final Four
summary: Auburn eked out a 77-71 overtime win against Kentucky in the Midwest Regional Final on Sunday, outlasting a Wildcat squad that outshot and outmuscled them in the paint for much of the game.

headline: Ethiopian, U.S. Investigators Tussle Over Crash Probe
summary: Tension is simmering between U.S. and Ethiopian officials as investigators prepare to release an interim report about the Boeing 737 MAX jetliner that nose-dived after takeoff from Addis Ababa on March 10.

headline: New York City Set to Get First Congestion Pricing System in Country
summary: New York lawmakers were poised to create a congestion-pricing system in Manhattan, increase taxes on real-estate transactions in New York City and move toward a public campaign financing system as part of a $175.5 billion budget deal.

headline: Biden Denies Inappropriate Behavior Toward Women After Allegation
summary: Joe Biden said he didn’t believe he had ever acted inappropriately toward women but would “listen respectfully” to those who said he had, addressing a controversy as he considers entering the presidential race.

headline: Erdogan’s Party Faces Election Setback in Turkey
summary: The party of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan appeared set to lose political control of the capital and several other big cities in local elections, a rare electoral setback in the Turkish leader’s 16-year rule that capped months of growing economic malaise.

headline: Pope Francis Defends Migrants After Morocco Visit
summary: Pope Francis ended his two-day visit to Morocco with strong words in defense of migrants, emphasizing one of the main themes of the trip and of his pontificate as he pushed back against rising anti-immigration sentiment around the world.

headline: Economist’s Path From Academia to Politics
summary: In 1998, economist Stephanie Kelton published a seminal paper on how the government finances spending. In recent years, drawn to the prospect of shaping policy, she has advised Sen. Bernie Sanders.

headline: The Border Asylum Crisis
summary: A broken asylum system all but guarantees entry if you bring children.

headline: Jackpot Junk Science
summary: Scientists say a weed killer is safe, but a judge excludes evidence.

headline: Zuckerberg for Regulation
summary: Beware of tech CEOs bearing gifts from government.

headline: The Villain in the Russian Collusion Is Vladimir Putin
summary: Now that the Mueller report has been completed, some of the debilitating partisanship might be toned down and our energy refocused on a real and present danger that should unite us all—Vladimir Putin.

headline: Reparations for Slavery Open Pandora’s Box
summary: Sen. Elizabeth Warren is proposing a full on discussion about reparations for slavery. By all means, let’s have that discussion. But it must be a serious discussion that addresses in detail to whom reparations should be paid and how.

headline: A DiCaprio Approach to Limiting Wildfires
summary: The most effective steps for protecting homes during wildfires involve retrofitting roofs, vent screens and other home features, along with trimming vegetation within 100 feet of homes.

headline: Economy Week Ahead: Retail Sales, Durable Goods, Jobs Report
summary: In the week ahead, the U.S. will see data on retail sales, durable goods and the latest employment picture.

headline: Prince Charles and the Torturers
summary: As he visits Havana, a new report details the Cuba-backed horrors of Venezuela’s regime.

headline: A ‘Tiny’ Tax on Trades Would Hobble Markets
summary: Intended to halt high-frequency swaps, the levy would discourage low-cost investing.

headline: ‘Devices and Desires’ Review: Social Climbing in a Tudor Style
summary: Born into the minor gentry, Bess of Hardwick rose to become a friend of Queen Elizabeth and, dangerously, Mary, Queen of Scots.

headline: Another Panel? Change the Channel
summary: On ‘Meet the Pest,’ they think they’re experts on everything.

headline: The Right and the Moral High Ground
summary: Today minorities suffer from underdevelopment, not racism. And here, at last, is conservatism’s great opportunity.

headline: Beijing’s Chilling Imprisonment of a Taiwanese Critic
summary: Communist authorities say Li Ming-che violated domestic law but deny him a citizen’s legal rights.

headline: ‘Dumbo’ Fails to Take Flight at Box Office
summary: Walt Disney Co.’s live-action remake of “Dumbo” took in a lackluster $45 million in the U.S. and Canada. With a budget of $170 million, the movie appears likely to be Disney’s first flop of the year.

headline: Authorities Probe Rape Claim Against NBA Star Kristaps Porzingis
summary: The New York Police Department is investigating a woman’s allegation that NBA star Kristaps Porzingis raped her last year, an accusation that Porzingis denied through his attorney and referred months ago to federal authorities to investigate for alleged extortion.

headline: Brokers Fear Proposed Real-Estate Tax Could Deepen Sales Slump in Manhattan Apartments
summary: While the New York real-estate industry fretted about the potential impact of new state taxes on expensive real estate, the Manhattan residential market deteriorated further in the first quarter as sales slumped to the slowest pace in six years.

headline: A Judge Wants to Control PG&E’s Dividends
summary: A federal judge is threatening to prevent PG&E from resuming dividend payments to shareholders until it reduces its role in sparking California wildfires, an action with little precedent that could have big repercussions for other companies put on probation.

headline: Walgreens Isn’t Ready to Quit Cigarette Sales Yet
summary: Under pressure from federal regulators and some investors, Walgreens Boots Alliance is testing tobacco-free stores in the U.S., but the pharmacy chain’s leader has no plans to quit selling cigarettes entirely.

headline: Tech IPOs Could Be Boon for California Budget
summary: Already flush with revenue from its healthy economy and growing number of high earners, California is expecting a tax windfall from a slate of initial public offerings that began Friday with Lyft.

headline: Google Can’t Please Everyone
summary: Google hasn’t been clicking for investors lately. In part, that is because there is only so much one of the world’s largest and highest-valued companies can do to look small.

headline: Goldilocks Is Back in the House
summary: The first quarter of 2019 wasn’t so good, but moods have brightened lately.

headline: Care.com Removed Tens of Thousands of Unverified Listings
summary: Online child-care marketplace Care.com removed from its site tens of thousands of unverified day-care center listings just before a WSJ investigation was published.

headline: Crypto Fundraising Slows Markedly
summary: The market for initial coin offerings, which boomed last year after the surge in bitcoin and other digital currencies, has fallen sharply in 2019 amid a regulatory crackdown.

headline: China’s Riskiest Dollar Bonds Are Surging
summary: A fear gauge for the junk bond market has receded. Prices of U.S. dollar bonds issued by Chinese companies with non-investment-grade credit ratings surged in the first quarter of 2019, rewarding investors who bought the securities when many of them were trading at distressed levels last year.

headline: Too Volatile, or Too Calm, Markets Still Aren’t Just Right for Wall Street
summary: A decline in volatility contributed to expectations for weaker trading results at banks in the first quarter.

headline: Sizing Up Stocks’ Big First-Quarter Rally
summary: Investors hoping for stocks’ rally to keep up the first quarter’s pace may be headed for a disappointment.

headline: Debt Investors at a Crossroads as Fed Pivots
summary: A sharp drop in Treasury yields has stirred a debate among investors about whether to take heart from the central bank’s pivot to a more growth-friendly posture or be wary of the potentially troubling causes that prompted the shift.

headline: ‘Fear of Missing Out’ Pushes Investors Toward Stocks
summary: As the rally in stocks continues, powering major indexes toward last year’s records, investors say they are increasingly wary of missing out on further gains.

headline: Stocks Just Jumped, But Investors Aren’t in the Clear
summary: The S&P 500 just turned in its strongest first-quarter since the late 1990s, but the Federal Reserve, global economic jitters and a host of other factors are still top-of-mind for nervous investors.

headline: China Manufacturing Gauge Rebounds
summary: An official gauge of activity in China’s crucial manufacturing sector rose to a six-month high in March, suggesting that Beijing’s support policies are gaining traction.

headline: In Europe’s Nationalist Hotbed, Slovakia Takes a Liberal Turn
summary: Slovakia elected its first female president, a liberal and pro-European anticorruption candidate whose rise is seen as a rebuke of the conservative nationalism remaking its larger neighbors.

headline: Virginia Outlasts Purdue to Head to Final Four
summary: It took a miracle finish but Virginia is headed to the Final Four. The Cavaliers beat Purdue 80-75 in overtime of the South Regional final on Saturday night.

headline: Texas Tech’s Defense Trips Up Gonzaga
summary: Texas Tech upset No. 1 seed Gonzaga, 75-69, in the West Regional final to secure the Red Raiders’ first trip ever to the Final Four.

headline: A Buyer’s Market? Hopes Rise With Falling Rates, More Homes for Sale
summary: The spring home-buying season is shaping up as the best in years after last year’s tough housing market drove many would-be purchasers away.

headline: Trump Officials Try to Defend Plan to Cut Aid to Three Central American Nations
summary: Senior administration officials sought to defend President Trump’s proposal to cut foreign aid to three Central American countries he says are complicit in the flow of illegal migrants toward the U.S., following a wave of criticism that the move was counterproductive.

headline: Comedian Leads in First Round as Ukraine Votes for President
summary: A comedian with no political experience was poised to win the first round of Ukraine’s presidential elections Sunday as disillusionment with the political elite simmers ahead of a likely runoff on April 21.

headline: Chicago Prepares to Elect Its First Black Female Mayor
summary: The final days of the historic Chicago mayor’s race between two black women have turned so acrimonious that the Rev. Jesse Jackson has called for reconciliation between the two candidates the day after the election.

headline: The New York Yankees’ Lost Decade
summary: The New York Yankees haven’t gone a calendar decade without a pennant since the 1910s—and their drought exemplifies modern baseball’s landscape.

headline: Can the U.S. Afford Democrats’ Bold Promises? Why One Economist Says Yes
summary: As Democrats present ambitious policy proposals, they are frequently asked how they will be paid for. The answer, increasingly, comes from Stephanie Kelton, the public face of modern monetary theory.

headline: Avenatti vs. Nike: The Showdown That Ensnared a Celebrity Lawyer
summary: A secretly recorded meeting and a tax investigation lead to extortion and fraud charges. Michael Avenatti says he is being “railroaded” and expresses confidence he will be exonerated.

headline: After Smollett, Chicago’s Mayoral Runoff Turns Nasty
summary: The race to succeed Rahm Emanuel pits the Windy City’s new left against its old Democratic machine.

headline: Fake News Runs Wild in India as Elections Loom
summary: Viral fake news is lighting up Facebook’s WhatsApp messaging app as the world’s biggest democracy prepares for national elections in the coming weeks.

headline: Fewer People Have Doubts About Trump After Mueller, Poll Finds
summary: A new Wall Street Journal/NBC News poll finds fewer Americans with doubts about Donald Trump with the completion of the Mueller report, though 40% think it didn’t clear the president of wrongdoing.

headline: Democrats Woo Farm Belt Voters by Taking Aim at Agriculture Firms
summary: Democratic presidential candidates pitched voters in Iowa on their plans to stir up competition in the agriculture industry and stem the conglomeration of corporate power in the U.S.

headline: Apple News+ Is Great for Magazine Lovers, But It’s Not the Future of News
summary: Apple News+, the $10-a-month “Netflix for news” subscription service to magazines and newspapers, offers lots of titles, but news junkies can do way better.

headline: New Social Rules Leave Saudis Confused About How to Behave
summary: Saudi people and businesses are getting punished for social activity and speech they assumed were now acceptable.
